text: I don't mean just our direct military costs. I'm thinking of the African Boycott which is already working up. I'm afraid, Prime Minister, you're not going to like the trading position when you see it.' 'I never do,' the Prime Minister commented wearily. The Chancellor was repeating an argument which he had already developed for an hour before lunch. costs.
